start.text: Hey, traveler. You look like someone who listens before they swing a sword. The world is changing fast, and I need to tell you what is really happening.

choices.text: Make it quick, I have places to be.

who_are_you.text: Name is Lester. Folks call me Uncle Lester because I have seen more seasons than most. I keep my eyes open and my words honest.

choices.text: What is happening in the world?
I just need work, not history.

short_warning.text: Then hear this: a war is starting, and if you walk blind you will be crushed between nations.

world_overview.text: The peoples of spirit, bamboo, stone, and river have shared these lands for generations. Each kept their borders, honored their customs, and traded what the others lacked. That balance broke when a sacred bamboo grove was burned, and the spirit elders accused the bamboo clans of hiding the truth.

bamboo_position.text: The bamboo chiefs swear they are innocent. They say the grove was set ablaze by outsiders, meant to look like bamboo treachery. They are proud, but they are not fools. They know a war would break them.

choices.text: Tell me about stone and river.

spirit_position.text: The spirit people listen to the winds and read the ash. Their elders say the omen is clear: someone wants their faith to shatter. They are marching because they fear weakness more than blood.

choices.text: Tell me about stone and river.

stone_river_position.text: Stone once stood between spirit and bamboo, a hard wall that stopped raids. River carried news and trade, binding everyone together. Now stone is split: half wants to defend spirit honor, half wants to shield bamboo. River councils argue day and night, and their indecision is strangling trade.

hidden_hands.text: There are rumors of a fifth force, smugglers and relic hunters. They whisper about an ancient pact stone, a relic that could force the nations to heed a single voice. If that relic is found by the wrong hands, the war will become a conquest.

can_be_stopped.text: Maybe. The old treaties were written in river ink and sealed with bamboo wax. If the leaders meet, they might remember those vows. But someone must carry words of peace across the frontlines.

choices.text: I do not trust words to stop blades.

task.text: Then hear my request. Take this message to the bamboo camp and ask their chief to send a delegate to a council of peace. If they agree, I will try to draw spirit and river to the same table.

accept.text: Good. Be careful, and do not speak of the relic. Keep the message sealed and your eyes open. The roads are full of spies now.

decline.text: I will not shame you for refusing. But remember this: when the war reaches your door, you will wish you had moved sooner.

After bamboo.text: You are back. Tell me, did the bamboo chief listen? If they send a delegate, I will ride to the spirit elders and river councils tonight.

after_success.text: Then there is hope. Even stone will follow if they see unity. We might still save these lands from burning.

after_failure.text: Then we must try another path. If words failed, we may have to find the pact stone before the wrong hands do.

choices.text: Let me know how I can help.
